Condemned to Death

A dark Semyonovsky Square, soldiers surround prisoners.  
Dostoevsky: “I thought my life was over.”  

He kisses his friends goodbye.  
Dostoevsky: “Farewell, my dear ones.”  

Suddenly, the troops beat a tattoo.  
Soldier: “You’re spared! Back to the scaffold!”  

---
A grim prison cell, shadows loom large.  
Dostoevsky: “This suffering will shape my words.”  

Grigoryev, shaken, stares blankly.  
Grigoryev: “What have we become?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dostoevsky's near-execution and subsequent imprisonment profoundly influenced his writing and views on suffering and cruelty.
